derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, diminutive of mors 'a bite', from Latin mors- 'bitten', from the verb mordere

entry.tran: 一点点，一小份(尤指食物)
entry.def: A morsel is a very small amount of something, especially a very small piece of food.

sentences.sentence: "a morsel of paper was all he needed"

means.word_mean: 2. a small amount of solid food; a mouthful;

sentences.sentence: "all they had left was a bit of bread"
